result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard M. Sodke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution for Security Health Plan $1,515.65. - if objections, can file request for restitution hearing with Court Commission w/in 30 days.

If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Write an apology letter to the victim, to be given to the Agent first within 30 days of todays date.
No contact with victim A.L.B., except for the apology letter.
Provide DNA sample.
Comply with the sex offender reporting requirements under Section 301.45 of the Wisconsin Statues.

records.descr: Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Richard M. Sodke in court with attorney William George Weiland. Defendant Richard M. Sodke in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
11:22 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Court has received the Revocation Order and Warrant packet. 
Court questions if victims were notified. 
Atty Cousins indicates the file could not be located.  Asks to take time to verify in his office. 

11:24 a.m.  Court takes a brief recess to allow Atty Cousins to return to his office. 
11:30 a.m.  Court is back in session.  Appearances remain. 

Court questions Atty Cousins. 
Atty Cousins indicates victims were notified.  
The victim is not present today. 
Atty Cousins received the packet. 
Atty Weiland received the packet and has no deletions, additions or corrections. 

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Weiland makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT: 
Count 1 - 
2 years prison with 1 year initial confinement followed by 1 year extended supervision, consecutive to any other sentences. 

Count 2 - 
2 years prison with 1 year initial confinement followed by 1 year extended supervision, consecutive to Count 1 and any other sentences. 

Count 3 - 
2 years prison with 1 year initial confinement followed by 1 year extended supervision, concurrent with Counts 1 & 2 but consecutive to any other sentences. 

356 days credit. 

Not eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Substance Abuse programs. 
Comply with Sex Offender Registry.
No unapproved contact with anyone under the age of 18 years of age. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming controlled substances.
Pay restitution to Security Health in the amount of $1,515.65.
Pay the court costs that remain unpaid. 
Department of Corrections may take a reasonable amount from his prison account to be applied to restitution first then to the fine and costs.  Any balance remaining is a condition of extended supervision.
Atty William Weiland appointed
Memorandum from DOC dated 02-19-18
Sentencing hearing on revocation on May 15, 2018 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Count 1, 2 & 3
Order to Comply with Reporting Requirements of Section 301.45 /s/ TTF 06/16/16
Count 1, 2 & 3

8:51 a.m. Defendant Richard M. Sodke in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Defendant Richard M. Sodke in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case 16CF31, 16CM208, & 16CM209.
16CF31 Amended Information is filed and waived reading.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. 
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of:  16CF31 and 16CM208: No Contest pleas

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 16CF31 and 16CM208.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. 16CM209 and 16CM208 Counts 2 & 3 are dismissed and read in.
Victim notification was verified. State reads victim impactment statement.
ADA Knaapen makes sentencing recommendations to the Court and also requests sex offender registration. 
Atty Sheets concurs in part with recommendations, but objects to sex offender registration.

**BY THE COURT:***PROBATION***
16CF31 Count 1: 940.225(3m), misd. 4th Degree Sexual Assault: 171 days credit
W/H Sentence
24 months Probation
Conditions:
171 days jail - credit time served.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment.
50 hrs of Community Service to be done within the next 5 months preferrably at the Parks Dept.
Write an apology letter to the victim, to be given to the Agent first within 30 days of todays date.
No contact with victim A.L.B., except for the apology letter.
Pay restitution for Security Health Plan $1,515.65. - if objections, can file restitution hearing with Court Commission w/in 30 days.
Provide DNA sample.
Pay costs, VW's, and DNA sucharges.
Court to determine later if sex registration will be ordered.

16CF31: Count 2: 940.19(1) misd. Battery: 
W/H Sentence
24 months Probation, concurrent with Count 1
Conditions: Comply with same conditions as stated in Count 1.
171 days jail, concurrent - time served.
Pay costs, VW's and DNA surcharges.

16CF31:  Count 3: 946.41(1) misd. Resisting or Obstructing an Officer:
24 months Probation, concurrent with Count 1 & 2
Conditions: Comply with same conditions as stated in Count 1.
171 days jail, concurrent - time served.

16CM208: Count 1: misd. 943.34(1)(a) Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property: 
I/S Sentence:
200 days jail with first 100 in jail and balance on electronic monitor, if eligible according to jail rules. 15 days credit - Stayed
24 months Probation, concurrent with 16CF31
Conditions: Comply with same conditions as stated in 16CF31.
Pay costs, VW's, and DNA surcharges.
Parties have reached an agreement and Jury Trial is being cancelled

Defendant Richard M. Sodke in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Defendant Richard M. Sodke in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:39 PM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

This is on the calendar for a bond modification hearing. This is set for a jury trial next week.

Atty Sheets requests that this cash bond be covered in 16CM-208 and 16CM-209. Defendant has been incarcerated for 163 days and is indigent, for reasons stated on the record.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court, has not heard any reason that this bond is not appropriate other than it cannot be posted. Atty Knaapen believes this is still an appropriate bond.

Atty Sheets replies. 

Court addresses the parties.

BY THE COURT:
Court denies motion to modify the bond.
Court will proceed to trial next week Wednesday.

3:44 PM Court is adjourned for the day.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Reduce Bond filed by Atty Eric Sheets
2 Day Jury Trial set for 06/15/16 & 06/16/16 - attempted, not known
Return of Officer, Application for Search Warrant /s/ RJS 01/26/16 and Search Warrant /s/ RJS 01/26/16 (2 Search Warrants)
Jury trial on June 16, 2016 at 08:00 am.
Jury trial on June 15, 2016 at 08:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 11, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Richard M. Sodke in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Defendant Richard M. Sodke in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
3:34 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 10:30 am.
